name: sys::alloc::unix::aligned_malloc

core::ptr::null_mut.doc:
Creates a null mutable raw pointer.

 This function is equivalent to zero-initializing the pointer:
 `MaybeUninit::<*mut T>::zeroed().assume_init()`.
 The resulting pointer has the address 0.

 # Examples

 ```
 use std::ptr;

 let p: *mut i32 = ptr::null_mut();
 assert!(p.is_null());
 assert_eq!(p as usize, 0); // this pointer has the address 0
 ```

core::alloc::Layout::align.doc:
The minimum byte alignment for a memory block of this layout.

 The returned alignment is guaranteed to be a power of two.

core::alloc::Layout::size.doc: The minimum size in bytes for a memory block of this layout.
